title: SOCI7016 Quantitative Research Methods
text:
Welcome to the course website for Quantitative Research Methods, Fall 2025.
This course introduces you to data wrangling, visualization, and analysis using R, with applications to social science research.
Navigate using the menu above to find the syllabus, schedule, materials, and assignments.

title: Create a .nojekyll file in the project root to prevent GitHub from processing the site with Jekyll
text:
git remote add origin https://github.com/kwan-MSDA/SOCI7016_2025.git git branch -M main git add . git commit -m “Initial commit” git push -u origin main

Create a .nojekyll file in the project root to prevent GitHub from processing the site with Jekyll
#touch .nojekyll

title: Syllabus
text:
This course introduces data science techniques for social science research, covering data visualization, statistical modeling, and R programming.




Learn to wrangle and visualize data using R.
Understand statistical methods for social science research.
Apply quantitative methods to social science research data.





Attendance: Expected at all sessions.
Assignments: Submit via GitHub Classroom.
Grading: Based on problem sets, projects, and participation.

title: Syllabus
text:
Course Details

Time: 7pm-9:50pm

Location: TBA

Moodle:

Description: This course provides an introduction to quantitative research methods in social science research, covering statistical methods, data visualization, and causal inference using R
Prerequisites: None, though familiarity with basic statistics is helpful

text:
Course Overview

Objectives

Learn to wrangle and visualize data using R.
